beats.label: HOOK + PROMISE
beats.narration: Should you race Bear 100? I rated 328 gravel races on 14 dimensions. Bear 100 scored 44 out of 100. Grassroots tier. Here's what that actually means for your season.
beats.editing_note: STATE THE PREMISE IN 8 SECONDS. Clear value prop: 'I rated 328 races. Here's where this one lands.' This is the 8-second decision window. Viewers who stay past 15s are 58% more likely to finish.
beats.psych_mechanism: Curiosity gap (specific) + IKEA effect (viewer predicts the tier before reveal).

beats.label: THE COURSE
beats.narration: Bear 100. Laona, Wisconsin. 100 mi. Rolling Northwoods gravel through forest and rural areas.
beats.editing_note: Let the course breathe. Show the route map, then cut to terrain-specific B-roll. This is the SETUP phase — grounding the viewer before the data analysis. Pacing: 25-40 sec cuts.

beats.label: THE SCORES — Top 8
beats.narration: Time to break down the scorecard. Length. 4 out of 5. Bring real food. Not just gels. Five route options from 18-mile Friday pre-ride to 113-mile sufferfest accommodate all levels, with Laona Rescue Squad support ending at 7 PM sharp. Value. 4 out of 5. Good value. More bang for your buck than most. Five distance options from 18 to 113 miles with Performance Timing's professional chip timing, plus your registration supports Laona Rescue Squad instead of promoter profits. Expenses. 4 out of 5. Reasonable costs. Plan a modest budget. Community. 3 out of 5. Good vibes. Riders actually talk to each other. Twelve years of tradition in tiny Laona creates a small-town gathering with 100% of proceeds supporting Laona Rescue Squad equipment and training. Technicality. 2 out of 5. Your road bike might survive. Might. Elevation. 2 out of 5. Some ups and downs. Manageable. The 3,500 feet over 100 miles delivers rolling Wisconsin forest terrain without major sustained climbs. Climate. 2 out of 5. Mostly pleasant. Check the forecast anyway. Early May northern Wisconsin brings dramatic temperature swings from 31°F overnight frost to 85°F midday heat. Adventure. 2 out of 5. Mild adventure. Scenic ride with a number plate. Hidden gravel roads through Nicolet National Forest plus the 7 PM support cutoff creates consequence for route selection.
beats.editing_note: PROGRESSIVE RHYTHM: start tight (15-20 sec per dimension), slow down for the most interesting scores (30-40 sec). Each score: number appears, brief pause, explanation. Avatar reacts to extreme scores (5/5 = chef_kiss, 1/5 = facepalm). RE-ENGAGEMENT at 3:00 mark: insert a surprising score reveal or a meme reaction to break the pattern.

meme_insert.suggested_clip: avatar reaction to most extreme score

beats.label: THE SCORES — Also Scored
beats.narration: The rest. Quick-fire. Race Quality. 2 out of 5. Adequate. Room for improvement. Experience. 2 out of 5. A nice day on the bike. Nothing more. Logistics. 1 out of 5. Organizers communicate via telepathy, apparently. Altitude. 1 out of 5. Oxygen plentiful. Power output normal. Prestige. 1 out of 5. Nobody at the coffee shop will recognize this name. Field Depth. 1 out of 5. Sparse start line. Plenty of elbow room.
beats.editing_note: FAST PACING — 7 seconds per dimension. Quick-fire energy change from the deep analysis above. This is a PATTERN INTERRUPT through pacing shift.

weaknesses: Very remote location with minimal amenities

beats.label: LOGISTICS
beats.narration: The logistics. What you actually need to know.
beats.editing_note: Utility section. Lower energy, practical value. Hybrid Tempo: alternate fast logistics items (10-15 sec) with slow map visuals (30 sec).

logistics: Fly into: Green Bay or Milwaukee 3-4 hours drive
Lodging: Very limited lodging in Laona. Look for nearby towns or camping. Book early.

beats.label: VERDICT
beats.narration: Verdict: Northwoods Grassroots Century. Only if you're in Wisconsin and want an affordable, low-key 100-miler in a beautiful setting. Not worth traveling far for.
beats.editing_note: CLOSE THE MAIN LOOP. 0.5s silence before verdict. Tier badge slams in. Avatar delivers final take. DO NOT signal 'wrapping up' — maintain energy.

beats.label: ALTERNATIVES
beats.narration: If Bear 100 isn't quite right for you. For better Wisconsin events: Driftless Gravel, Chequamegon. For similar grassroots centuries: regional Midwest gravel events.
beats.editing_note: Bonus value — viewers who reach this point are highly engaged. Cross-reference other videos/races.

beats.editing_note: End ABRUPTLY after CTA. No 'thanks for watching' wind-down.
